group_works.title: Tomb of the lost king
group_works.creator_credit: Roy Davies and British Broadcasting Corporation

results.title: Tomb of the lost king
results.creator_credit: Roy Davies and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Chronicle”.
With the discovery in 1977 of Royal Tombs in the Greek village of Vergina, Greek archaeologist Manolis Andronikos uncovered the greatest prize left in Greek archaeology - the tomb of Philip II of Macedon. Shows the magnificent objects found inside the tomb including a mural believed to be the work of the ancient artist Nico Marco and examines the work and theories of the archaeologist. Narrated by Andrew Faulds.

results.title: The Incas
results.creator_credit: Anna Benson Gyles and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Chronicle”.
Little is known about the Inca empire, which stretched over 2,000 miles from Ecuador to Chile, during the 15th and 16th centuries. However archaeologists are busy digging behind the myths and legends surrounding the Incas and are learning more about how they ran their enormous empire so successfully. Narrated by Ian Holm.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Anna Benson Gyles and British Broadcasting Corporation

results.title: Chinese History

group_works.title: China: coming of the west
group_works.creator_credit: Wan-go Wen and China Institute in America

results.title: China: coming of the west
results.creator_credit: Wan-go Wen and China Institute in America
results.brief_description:
Episode number 12 of Series “Chinese History”.
Highlights the confrontation between the ideas and scientific knowledge of modern western civilization and ancient Chinese civilization from the 15th to 20th century. Provides historical background to the early influence of the Jesuit missionaries in feudal China, the 19th century trade treaties of industrial societies such as Britain and America. Colonisation by Japan and Russia in early 20th century is also discussed. Includes archival film including the establishment of the Republic of China in 1912.

results.title: Sports amateurs
results.creator_credit: Central Newsreel and Documentary Film Studio of the People's Republic of China
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “China Today”.
Newsreel presenting a rich variety of physical activities in China including the martial arts; winter sports such as skating and skiing; track and field; and roller skating.

results.creator_credit: Film Studio of the Peoples Republic of China
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “China Today”.
Focuses on the many leisure activities of Chinese workers and professionals. Cultural and artistic pursuits are an important part of the workers’ lifestyle.

results.title: Flower buds
results.creator_credit: Central Newsreel and Documentary Film Studio of the People's Republic of China
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “China Today”.
This film covers cultural aspects of children’s lives in China such as dance, children’s orchestra, singing, folk-dance, traditional music and instruments. Non-stylised overview of traditional cultural traditions as demonstrated by children.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Central Newsreel and Documentary Film Studio of the People’s Republic of China
